item.title: Pallets and light bulbs, 21st December
item.description:
Pallets and fluorescent light tubes dumped by shop‚Ä¶. AGAIN. Surely someone at the council is able to counsel this retailer not to leave their rubbish in our residential street, and find some manners to be more neighbourly, as this is a regular scenario !!!

item.title: 2 foot pothole in middle of road, 21st December
item.description:
This is a recurring pothole that is not mended properly - the whole of The Drive Beckenham needs resurfacing because putting a "plaster" over each time is not working
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Overflowing bins, 21st December
item.description:
Missed refuse collection has left overflowing bins in Gould Terrace. Foxes have ravaged the bins so the pavement and highway are now strewn with remains of food and other refuse. WE CANNOT GO THROUGH XMAS WITH THIS MESS - PLS COLLECT ASAP üôè

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gould Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subsiding road full width parkside avenue, 21st December
item.description:
There is an area of road surface outside 72/74 Parkside avenue that is subsiding across the width of the road. I ride a motorcycle and I am aware it's there but it caused a dangerous change of direction and bottoming of the front forks on early encounters. It is alongside a street drain and crosses the full width of the road, Suspect a colapsing pipe. More dangerous in the dark. This was previously reported and the case closed as completed, I assume putting a cone on the pavement constitutes a repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkside Avenue, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parked on pavement access problems for pedestrians and vehicles, 21st December
item.description:
Cars are being parked on pavement causing pedestrians cannot pass without walking in the road , no room for wheelchairs and pushchairs. These vehicles are also hampering vehicle access , emergency vehicles cannot pass as there are vehicles parked on opposite side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holmsdale Grove, North End, Greater London
